formats.name: micro_memoir
formats.instruction: Share a vivid memory in just three sentences. Focus on sensory details and a single emotion, skip the resolution.

formats.name: opposite_day
formats.instruction: Write an argument for something you completely disagree with, using convincing reasoning and examples. End with a rhetorical question.

formats.name: quick_artifact
formats.instruction: Describe an unusual object you own in one paragraph. Explain its history, your connection to it, and why it matters.

formats.name: soundtrack_of_today
formats.instruction: List the songs (max 3) or sounds that best capture your day. For each, briefly mention why it matches your mood or events.

formats.name: concept_vs_reality
formats.instruction: Pick something widely misunderstood. In one paragraph, contrast the popular idea with the messy real truth, using specific anecdotes.

formats.name: future_flash
formats.instruction: Imagine the forum 5 years from now. Write a short narrative or scene depicting a typical user interaction, including changes in tone, technology, or culture.

formats.name: emoji_story
formats.instruction: Tell a full story using only emojis and very brief captions. Alternate emoji lines (max 5) and text lines (max 5 words each).

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Give the worst advice possible for a specific practical problem, making it clear it’s a parody. Add a silly warning at the end.

formats.name: hidden_rules
formats.instruction: Reveal an unwritten rule about a community, job, or hobby. Explain where it shows up and why it matters, with one example of breaking it.

title_styles: Write a metaphorical, playful title. Examples: 'The office fridge is a miniature ecosystem', 'My coffee mug is a time machine'
Write a title that teases a mystery—no spoilers. Examples: 'Something strange happened on my commute today', 'Unusual patterns in our group chat'
Write a single-word title that captures the mood or topic. Examples: 'Momentum', 'Boundaries', 'Echoes'
Write a provocative question title. Examples: 'Would you trust AI with your diary?', 'What if Mondays disappeared?'
Write a title that sets up an expectation, then subverts it. Examples: 'Why working from home ruined my socks (but saved my sanity)'
structure_variants: Write as a diary entry, including your thoughts and questions to yourself.
Alternate between two contrasting viewpoints in separate mini-paragraphs.
Start and end with a one-sentence summary, sandwiching the main narrative between.
Begin with an outrageous claim, then challenge yourself to back it up in the body.
Embed one surreal image or metaphor in every paragraph.
